text: Good morning. So this morning we are at the Doi Suthep temple
at Chiang Mai, Tailand. We are going to climb those stairs. This
is a buddhist temple, like most of the temples here in Tailand
and its also one of the prettiest ones. It's going to be awesome.
There are a couple of different rules when visiting the buddhist
temples here; one, you have to make sure, specially if you are
female to be wearing your temple outfit, which is basically pretty
much covering your shoulders and covering your legs.
Having on top, means royal temple, plus the golden lotus flower
on top. Golden lotus is one of the symbol of Buddha, something
to pay respect to.
Right now we are about to go to the area where the monks are
to be blessed by a monk.

I just want to quickly point out to 
 you guys; we have stopped at
a place called Cabbages and Condoms. Cabbages and
Condoms. Awesome. This is Tailand for you. Our food is
guaranteed not to cause pregnancy. Good to know.
Hey guys, welcome to Chaing Rai. So we drove several hours
north from Chiang Mai and now we are in Chiang Rai, and we
are already at our first stop...oh my gosh...yes, we are here at
the Hill Tribe village, which is basically if you have seen the
National Geographic sort of stuff, it's the people with the long
necks, and the rings around the neck..you know what I'm talking
about. If not, I guess we will find out.
This is called the village of the union of the Hill Tribes, because
we also get to see different tribes all together in one place.

If the lady has 27 or 30 rings 
 around her neck and she feels like
this is good enough I'm done, then she goes with the same set
of rings forever. They only take the rings off when they want to
clean the rings or wash themselves, maybe a couple of times a
year. They don't do it often because the neck could be weak,
because the neck is used to some kind of support all the time
The rings are not making the neck getting longer at all,
The rings are not making the neck getting longer at all,
The rings are not making the neck getting longer at all,
What are your thoughts? It's amazing. I feel like it's a National
Geographic episode. It does feel like a National Geographic
episode.
Good evening guys. So right now I am standing here in the
middle of Chiang Rai night market, because we are having
dinner here, we are getting some market food and we are going
to try a couple of interesting types of food here.
Silk worm, crickets. Cheers. Pretty good.Taste almost like the
skin of the fry chicken. Exactly. Oh my, it squirted out of your
mouth. Alright, what should I try first, what do you recommend?
Silk worm. Alright silk worm. Taste like deep fried...crackly...
Cricket? Okay. I'm not going to look at it.
The cricket taste like..not bad.
